sen.j: 那須 光資（なす みつすけ、生没年不詳）は鎌倉時代の人物。
sen.e: Mitsusuke NASU (year of birth and death unknown) was a personality who lived during the Kamakura period.
Mitsusuke NASU (year of birth and death unknown) was a person who lived during the Kamakura period.
Mitsusuke NASU (year of birth and death unknown) was a person who lived during the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 下野国那須氏五代当主。
sen.e: He was the fifth head of the Nasu clan in Shimotsuke Province.
He was the fifth head of the Nasu clan in Shimotsuke Province.
He was the fifth head of the Nasu clan in Shimotsuke Province.

sen.j: 四代当主那須頼資の子。
sen.e: He is the son of the fourth family head Yorisuke NASU.
He was the son of the fourth family head, Yorisuke NASU.
sen.cmt: 過去の事実を示しているので、動詞を過去形に訂正し、また、"the fourth family head"と"Yorisuke NASU"の間にカンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: He was the son of the fourth family head, Yorisuke NASU.

sen.j: 六代当主那須資村の父。
sen.e: He was the father of the sixth family head Sukemura NASU.
He was the father of the sixth family head, Sukemura NASU.
sen.cmt: "the sixth family head"と"Sukemura NASU"の間にカンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: He was the father of the sixth family head, Sukemura NASU.
His highest government position was Hizen no kami (the governor of Hizen Province).
He was the Governor of Hizen Province.
sen.cmt: "his highest government position"であったのかどうかが不明なので、「肥前守であった」として英訳しました。「肥後守」→Governor of Higo Province
sen.e: He was the Governor of Hizen Province.
He was also called Taro.
He was also called Taro.
He was also called Taro.

sen.j: 建久4年（1193年）、源頼朝から下野国内に領地を拝領し、さらに那須において巻狩を催した際、接待役を務め、鎌倉幕府の御家人としての那須氏の地位向上に努めた。
sen.e: He was given the territory in Shimotsuke Province by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, and when Makigari (a hunting session) was held in Nasu, he served as a person in charge of entertaining the participants in order to elevate the Nasu clan's position as a family of gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods)within the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 巻狩→Makigari (a hunting session)としました。接待役→a person in charge of entertaining the participantsとしました。
sen.e: In 1193, he received a territory in Shimotsuke Province from MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, and when Makigari (a hunting session) was held in Nasu, he served as a person in charge of entertaining the participants so as to elevate the Nasu clan's status as gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods)of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 「建久4年（1193年）」の訳が抜けていました。領地→a territory（下野国内のどの領地か特定されていないので、不定冠詞に変更しました。）拝領する→receive
sen.e: In 1193, he received a grant of territory in Shimotsuke Province from MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, and when a hunting session was held in Nasu, he served as the attendant in charge of entertaining the participants, which elevated the Nasu clan's status as a gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 正治元年（1199年）には領内に天性寺を創建している。
sen.e: In 1199 he founded Tensho-ji Temple within his territory
In 1199, he founded Tensho-ji Temple within his territory.
sen.cmt: "In 1199"の後にカンマを付け、文尾にピリオドを付け足しました。
sen.e: In 1199, he founded Tensho-ji Temple within his territory.

sen.j: なお、建久4年に催された那須巻狩の際に、那須与一が梶原景時といさかいをおこし、出家遁世したという説があるが、『吾妻鏡』のその前後の時期の記述には「那須太郎光助」しか登場しない。
sen.e: There is a story that owing to the conflict that NASU no Yoichi had with Kagetoki KAJIWARA during the hunting session Nasu Makigari in 1193 (表記の変更), he entered into priesthood, however in "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), the description around that period touches only a personality called 'NASU no Taro Mitsusuke.'
sen.cmt: 那須巻狩→the hunting session Nasu Makigariとしました。
sen.e: Although there is a theory that NASU no Yoichi entered into priesthood and retired because he had a conflict with Kagetoki KAJIWARA when the hunting session Nasu Makigari was held in 1193, only 'NASU no Taro Mitsusuke' appeared in a description about the period before and after that in "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East).
sen.cmt: 説があるが、→Although there is a theory（althoughで始まる文章に変更しました。）遁世→retired（訳抜けしていたので、補いました。）その前後の時期の記述→description about the period before and after that（「その前後の時期についての記述」という意味なので、変更しました。）
sen.e: Although there is a theory that NASU no Yoichi entered into priesthood and retired because he had a conflict with Kagetoki KAJIWARA when the hunting session Nasu Makigari was held in 1193, only 'NASU no Taro Mitsusuke' appeared in a description about the period before and after that in "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East).
